result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chuck P. Baker

defendant.name: Baker, Chuck P.
defendant.address: 12042 W Ohio Ave, West Allis, WI 53227

records.addlTxt:
1:36 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Chuck P. Baker in court.  Attorney Daniel C. Nedset in court for Chuck P. Baker.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Nedset advises he just received the blood test results from the State, but is waiting for the amended complaint to be filed as well as received an offer from the State.  Atty. Nedset is requesting a further proceedings date in about 45 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings. State also notes they have filed an amended information today adding Count 2.  Atty. Nedset acknowledges receipt, waives reading and enters initial not guilty plea.  Court will accept the filing and initial plea.  Court will adjourn for status.
Hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

10:03 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Chuck P. Baker in court.  Attorney Daniel C. Nedset in court for Chuck P. Baker. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. Signed by Judge Paul Reilly on 8/11/22
Filed by Atty. Nedset requesting to have the 8/18/2022 hearing rescheduled, or in the alternative to be able to appear by Zoom.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring and/or drug testing through WCS.  CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.  Defendant to have no contact with witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

02:06 PM Defendant Chuck P. Baker in court, in custody, with attorney  State Public Defender Law Intern, as a friend of the court.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
